revised_title: Numerical Modeling of Detonation Performance in Energetic Materials
tldr: This article discusses various levels of detonation models, from ideal detonation to computational fluid dynamic models, to understand and predict the performance of energetic materials. The authors explore the chemical reaction rate vector, composition of explosives, and their application to steady-state detonation. They analyze the detonation performance of different explosives, including Composition B3, RDX emulsions, and PBX W115, and discuss the effect of morphology on ideality.
